questions.question: Who said the following quote: "I am polluted. I am the embodiment of evil.”

choices.answer: Oedipus
Creon
Tiresias
Jocasta

questions.question: Which of the following symbolizes Oedipus’ fateful decision to kill his father, thus setting his fate into motion.

choices.answer: The crowd gathered outside the temple.
The boy that leads Tiresias by the hand.
The place where three roads meet (the crossroads).
The riddle of the sphynx (the monster attacking Thebes).

questions.question: What is a claim that Tiresias makes?

choices.answer: He accuses Creon of killing King Laius.
He accuses Oedipus of marrying his mother.
He accuses Oedipus of killing King Laius.
He accuses Creon of marrying his mother.

questions.question: Why is there a conflict between Creon and Oedipus?

choices.answer: Oedipus accuses Creon of killing the Sphynx.
Oedipus accuses Creon of releasing a plague.
Oedipus accuses Creon of trying to kill King Laius.
Oedipus accuses Creon of trying to overthrow him.

questions.question: What detail from Jocasta’s speech makes Oedipus have an epiphany (a sudden realization)?

choices.answer: When she mentions that her son was adopted by the King of Corinth
When she mentions that Laius was killed at a place where three roads meet
When she mentions that Tiresias cannot be trusted with the future of Thebes
When she mentions that Creon may be more than just an uncle to Oedipus

questions.question: What kind of a king is Oedipus?

choices.answer: He is cruel and unfair
He is careless and aloof
He is proud and paranoid
He is angry and vengeful

questions.question: Why was Tiresias vague when Oedipus asked him to identify the killer?

choices.answer: He didn't want to show his guilt with as the killer
He didn't want Oedipus to realize he conspired with Creon
He didn't want to give Oedipus bad news for the kingdom
He didn't want Oedipus to discover that he simply does not know

questions.question: Why did Oedipus really accuse Creon and Tiresias?

choices.answer: Oedipus can't accept the fact that he is the most likely killer
Oedipus is still angry that they allowed him marry his mother
Oedipus knows that they sent him to be killed as a baby
Oedipus can't accept the fact that they solved the riddle of the Sphynx

questions.question: Which option best paraphrases Creon’s response to being accused of treason?

choices.answer: Creon denies it and says he was out of town at the time of the murder
Creon denies it and says that he has no desire to be king at all
Creon denies it but agrees that he wants to be king more than anything else
Creon denies is and says that Jocasta wants him to be the new king

questions.question: Which description best fits the relationship between Jocasta and Oedipus?

choices.answer: They are loving and trusting of one another
They are suspicious and do not trust one another
They are angry and fight with one another
They are lonely and spend no time with one another

questions.question: Which of the following statements that Oedipus says is an example of irony?

choices.answer: It is ironic when Oedipus asks Tiresias for help.
It is ironic when Oedipus curses Laius’ killer.
It is ironic when Oedipus solves the riddle of the Sphynx.
It is ironic when Oedipus goes to the oracle at Delphi.

questions.question: What role does the Chorus have in the play?

choices.answer: They represent the people of Corinth and they warn King Polybus about Creon
They represent the servants in the castle and they offer advice to Jocasta
They represent the people of Thebes and they offer advice to King Oedipus
They represent the children of Thebes and they show the truth of the plague

questions.question: At the end of Part 1, what is Oedipus hoping for?

choices.answer: He is hoping that King Laius was killed by his uncle Creon
He is hoping that King Laius was killed by a single highwayman
He is hoping that King Laius was killed by the Sphynx
He is hoping that King Laius was killed by a group of highwaymen

questions.question: Which of the following themes is most strongly emphasized in Oedipus Pt. 1?

choices.answer: It is not worth it to marry a family member
It is not worth it to try to fight your fate
It is not worth it to go to discover your future
It is not worth it to lie about a crime
His main flaw (or tragic flaw) is that he has too much pride.
His main flaw (or tragic flaw) is that he does not trust anyone.
His main flaw (or tragic flaw) is that he lies about his crimes.
His main flaw (or tragic flaw) is that he hated his father.

questions.question: What kind of conflict is Oedipus struggling with the most?

choices.answer: Oedipus struggles with man vs. man: his conflict with Creon
Oedipus struggles with man vs. nature: his conflict with the plague
Oedipus struggles with man vs. self: his internal struggle with himself
Oedipus struggles with man vs. society: his conflict with the citizens
